## Comandos de Unix

pwd : print working directory

\~ : significa que nos encontramos en el "home directory"

--\> mosia\@LAPTOP-J59PJJDU MINGW64 \~

ls : lista todo el contenido del directory

mkdir : crea un directory en donde nos encontremos.

--\> mkdir docs teaching (agrega dos directories)

rmdir : elimina un directory

cd : change directory

--\> cd projects (entraremos al directory projects) mosia\@LAPTOP-J59PJJDU MINGW64 \~/projects

cd .. : return to parent directory

cd \~ : return to home directory no matter where we are

cd \~/projects : ir a un directory escribiendo todo el path out

cd ../.. : return to the parent directory of the parent directory

cd : Si se pone a secas regresaremos al home directory

mv: move command

--\> mv path_to_file path_to_destination_directory

![](images/paste-5A0BBA51.png)

also, with this can chage the name of the document: mv cv.text resume.text

cp : copy just **files** - similar to mv, por el momento no directories

rm: remove just files - is **permanent!!**, por el momento no directories

less : take a look to the file -- press q to exit
